meanings.definition: To add up to a total
meanings.sent1: The coins in my piggy bank amounted to ten dollars.
meanings.sent2: The total cost of the groceries amounted to fifty dollars.
meanings.sent3: I never thought my spare change would amount to so much money!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness amounted to a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room amounted to a buzzing beehive.

meanings.sent1: His hard work amounted to success in the end.
meanings.sent2: The effort she put in amounted to recognition from her peers.
meanings.sent3: His love for chocolate could amount to a whole factory of sweets!
meanings.sent4: The teacher's guidance amounted to a light in the darkness for her students.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky amounted to a twinkling blanket above us.

meanings.sent1: The donations amounted to one thousand dollars for the charity.
meanings.sent2: The number of attendees amounted to two hundred people at the event.
meanings.sent3: His collection of stamps could amount to a world record someday!
meanings.sent4: Her determination amounted to a mountain that she climbed with pride.
meanings.sent5: The applause in the auditorium amounted to a roaring wave of sound.
